description: Golden test set for Karl RAG system - 50+ Q&A pairs with ground truth

test_cases.question: What is the starting pay for an All Purpose Clerk?
test_cases.ground_truth: The starting pay for an All Purpose Clerk is $16.00/hour effective 1/23/2022, $16.50/hour effective 1/22/2023, and $17.00/hour effective 1/21/2024.

test_cases.question: How much does a Courtesy Clerk make after 36 months?
test_cases.ground_truth: A Courtesy Clerk earns $16.55/hour (2022), $17.05/hour (2023), or $17.55/hour (2024) after 36 months.

test_cases.question: What is the Head Clerk rate of pay?
test_cases.ground_truth: The Head Clerk rate is $22.51/hour (2022), $23.31/hour (2023), or $24.11/hour (2024).

test_cases.question: What is the night premium?
test_cases.ground_truth: A premium of $2.00 per hour is paid for all work performed between midnight and 6:00 a.m., except for Courtesy Clerks who receive $0.25 per hour extra.

test_cases.question: Is there a Sunday premium?
test_cases.ground_truth: Yes, time and one-quarter (1.25x) is paid for Sunday work.

test_cases.question: What is the top pay rate for an All Purpose Clerk?
test_cases.ground_truth: After 7800 hours, an All Purpose Clerk earns $21.01/hour (2022), $21.81/hour (2023), or $22.61/hour (2024). Grandfathered employees earn $21.51/$22.31/$23.11.

test_cases.question: When do I get overtime pay?
test_cases.ground_truth: Overtime at 1.5x rate is paid for: (a) hours over 8 in one day, (b) hours over 40 in one workweek, (c) hours worked before scheduled start when less than 8 hours has elapsed since last quitting time.

test_cases.question: What is the overtime rate?
test_cases.ground_truth: Overtime is paid at time and one-half (1.5x) the employee's base hourly rate.

test_cases.question: Can I work a 4x10 schedule?
test_cases.ground_truth: Yes, upon mutual agreement between the Employer and employee, a full-time employee can work four 10-hour days. Overtime is computed for hours over 40, and hours over 8 do not trigger daily overtime for these shifts.

test_cases.question: Do I have to stay past my scheduled shift?
test_cases.ground_truth: No. No employee shall be subject to discipline for failure to remain at work beyond the end of their scheduled shift. The company should use best efforts to give 2 hours notice if extra work is needed.

test_cases.question: How far in advance must the schedule be posted?
test_cases.ground_truth: The master schedule must be completed and posted by 9:00 AM on Friday prior to the start of the next workweek.

test_cases.question: What is the minimum shift length?
test_cases.ground_truth: Daily scheduled shifts shall not be less than 4 hours or more than 8 hours at straight time.

test_cases.question: How does schedule bidding work?
test_cases.ground_truth: Employees select their schedule from posted shifts in seniority order within their department. Full-time employees select first, followed by part-time employees.

test_cases.question: When can I bid to a different department?
test_cases.ground_truth: Department bidding is allowed during the first 15 days of February (effective first week of March) and first 15 days of August (effective first week of September).

test_cases.question: What are the minimum weekly hours for full-time?
test_cases.ground_truth: Full-time employees should be scheduled 40 hours per week (32 hours in a holiday week).

test_cases.question: How is seniority calculated?
test_cases.ground_truth: Seniority is the length of continuous employment with the Employer, dated from the first day worked.

test_cases.question: When do I lose my seniority?
test_cases.ground_truth: Seniority terminates for: quit, just cause discharge, layoff exceeding recall period, failure to return from leave, failure to report for 3 consecutive days without notice.

test_cases.question: What is the recall period after layoff?
test_cases.ground_truth: The recall period is typically based on length of service. Employees must return within the specified time or lose seniority.

test_cases.question: How does bumping work during a layoff?
test_cases.ground_truth: When displaced, a senior employee may claim the schedule of a less senior employee in the same classification. The displaced employee then receives layoff options.

test_cases.question: What are my options if I'm laid off as a full-time employee?
test_cases.ground_truth: You may: 1) Displace the least senior full-time employee in the bargaining unit, or 2) Step down to part-time and displace the least senior part-time employee.

test_cases.question: How much vacation do I get?
test_cases.ground_truth: For employees hired on or before March 26, 2005: 1 week after 1 year, 2 weeks after 2 years, 3 weeks after 5 years, 4 weeks after 12 years.

test_cases.question: Does unused vacation roll over?
test_cases.ground_truth: Yes, accrued and unused vacation shall roll over from anniversary year to anniversary year.

test_cases.question: How far in advance must I request vacation?
test_cases.ground_truth: Vacation requests should generally be submitted in advance. Specific timing requirements may apply.

test_cases.question: How does sick leave accrue?
test_cases.ground_truth: Full-time employees hired before 2005 accrue 1 hour per 24 hours worked. Others accrue 1 hour per 30 hours worked. Maximum 48 hours earned per benefit year.

test_cases.question: Can I use sick leave for mental health?
test_cases.ground_truth: Yes, sick leave can be used for mental or physical health of the employee or family member.

test_cases.question: What is the maximum sick leave I can accrue?
test_cases.ground_truth: Maximum 48 hours earned per benefit year.

test_cases.question: What are my Weingarten rights?
test_cases.ground_truth: When involved in a disciplinary interview that could lead to discipline or termination, you have the right to request union representation before answering questions.

test_cases.question: Can I be fired without cause?
test_cases.ground_truth: No. After the probationary period, discharge must be for good and sufficient cause. You have recourse to the grievance and arbitration procedures.

test_cases.question: What is the probationary period?
test_cases.ground_truth: The first sixty (60) calendar days of employment is the probationary/trial period, during which an employee may be terminated for any reason without recourse to grievance or arbitration.

test_cases.question: How long do I have to file a grievance?
test_cases.ground_truth: Grievance submission must be made within 20 days of the date of occurrence (14 days for discharge cases).

test_cases.question: What is the grievance procedure?
test_cases.ground_truth: The grievance procedure involves multiple steps, starting with informal resolution and potentially proceeding to arbitration.

test_cases.question: How far back can I get retroactive pay?
test_cases.ground_truth: Retroactive pay error correction is limited to 90 days prior to grievance presentation.

test_cases.question: What are my break periods?
test_cases.ground_truth: Relief periods are provided for rest breaks. Employees also receive lunch breaks during shifts.

test_cases.question: How long is my lunch break?
test_cases.ground_truth: Lunch break duration is specified in the contract for different shift lengths.

test_cases.question: What are the duties of a Courtesy Clerk?
test_cases.ground_truth: Courtesy Clerk duties are limited to: sorting, bagging, and packing merchandise; carrying and loading sold merchandise; floor maintenance; cleaning parking lot and store areas; collecting trash; shopping cart collection; hanging signs; returning unsold merchandise; facing shelves; and delivery.

test_cases.question: What is a Head Clerk?
test_cases.ground_truth: A Head Clerk is an employee assigned by the Employer to direct or supervise the work of others. The mere fact that two persons work together does not mean one is a Head Clerk.

test_cases.question: Can I work in a different classification?
test_cases.ground_truth: Employees may perform incidental work in another classification. Any employee of a higher classification can be assigned work in a lower classification without restriction.

test_cases.question: Do I have to join the union?
test_cases.ground_truth: Yes. All employees must become and remain union members on the 31st day following employment or the effective date of the agreement.

test_cases.question: Can a union representative visit the store?
test_cases.ground_truth: Yes. The President of the Union or Business Representative has the right to enter the premises for purposes of collective bargaining representation.

test_cases.question: How many personal holidays do I get?
test_cases.ground_truth: Employees hired before March 26, 2005 get 2 personal holidays. After that date: 1 personal holiday after 2 years, 2 after 3 years, 3 after 4 years of service.

test_cases.question: How do I request a personal holiday?
test_cases.ground_truth: Personal holidays must be requested 2 weeks in advance.

test_cases.question: What are the recognized holidays?
test_cases.ground_truth: The contract specifies holidays including New Year's Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas.

test_cases.question: Is there a 401k plan?
test_cases.ground_truth: Yes, there is a 401K plan available to employees.

test_cases.question: Do I get health insurance?
test_cases.ground_truth: Health and welfare coverage is provided under Article 40, with eligibility requirements based on hours worked.

test_cases.question: Is there a pension plan?
test_cases.ground_truth: Yes, there is a pension plan covered under Article 42.

test_cases.question: What are my safety rights?
test_cases.ground_truth: The contract includes safety provisions to protect employees. Safety-related concerns should be reported immediately.

test_cases.question: What happens if I get injured at work?
test_cases.ground_truth: Article 37 covers injury on the job, including workers compensation and return-to-work procedures.

test_cases.question: When do I punch the time clock?
test_cases.ground_truth: Employees shall punch the time clock immediately before beginning work and immediately upon ending work.

test_cases.question: Can I be disciplined for time clock errors?
test_cases.ground_truth: No employee shall be disciplined for time entry errors caused by equipment or software malfunctions. No free work or off-the-clock work practices are allowed.

test_cases.question: I'm being called to a meeting about my performance. What should I do?
test_cases.ground_truth: If the meeting could lead to discipline, you have the right to request union representation (Weingarten rights). Request a steward before answering questions.

test_cases.question: My manager is harassing me. What are my rights?
test_cases.ground_truth: The contract prohibits discrimination and harassment. Contact your steward immediately to discuss filing a grievance and documenting incidents.

test_cases.question: I was just terminated. What should I do?
test_cases.ground_truth: You have 14 days to file a grievance for discharge. Contact your steward immediately. You may be entitled to reinstatement if the termination was not for just cause.

test_cases.question: What color shoes can I wear?
test_cases.ground_truth: Shoes must be black or white, clean and in good condition. Open toe or open heel shoes are not permitted.

test_cases.question: Can I bring my dog to work?
test_cases.ground_truth: This is not covered in the contract. Please contact your manager or steward.

test_cases.question: Will I win my grievance?
test_cases.ground_truth: I cannot predict outcomes. The arbitration process evaluates each case based on contract language and facts. Contact your steward to discuss your case.
